name: Volvo Cars Tech Fund
description: We aim to build and nurture a portfolio of high-potential startups in the mobility space that can scale and become our closest partners to help us create better and more competitive products and services.
investmentAreas: Mobility, IoT, Computer Vision, VR/XR, Automotive

name: STOAF
description: STOAF, is an early stage VC fund, registered as an AIF under the EuVECA framework. Started in 2008, STOAF is now operating its third fund, STOAF III SciTech. The focus is on early stage investments in sustainable research based spin-outs within deep tech and life sciences.
investmentAreas: Sustainable Energy Technologies, Advanced ICT, Advanced Industrial Technologies, Life Sciences

name: Oxx Ventures
description: Oxx partners with the most promising European B2B software companies at the scale-up stage. As a specialist SaaS investor, Oxx provides each entrepreneur with a support system of unique specialist expertise and network, and a culture of unfaltering partnership and absolute conviction. The firm’s strategy is built around the concept of “Go-To-Market Fit”, developing a structure for thinking about how to build a repeatable, sustainable growth engine that accelerates and propels the growth of SaaS companies. Oxx was founded by Richard Anton and Mikael Johnsson in 2017 and is headquartered in London and Stockholm.
investmentAreas: AI, Cybersecurity, HRtech, Martech, B2B, SaaS, Climate

name: Goose Valley Ventures
description: Investing in Nordic FinTech & Impact stars. Goose Valley is invested in some of the leading FinTechs in the Nordics: Klarna, Lunar, Open Payments, Receipt Hero, Indo. The name Goose Valley comes from the U-shaped valley Lapporten, a symbol of Sweden and its magnificent nature. In Northern Sami it is called Čuonjávággi which translates into Goose Valley.
investmentAreas: Fintech, Payments, Digital Banking, Lending, Insurtech

name: eEquity
description: eEquity is a sector-focused fund, investing in the intersection between technology and retail including companies with physical products, digital services and software. We actively invest in the digital space, having led 40 platform investments deploying over EUR 420 million. Our preference is to invest as the first institutional investor. Our investments range from EUR 5-20 million per company. Typically, we take large minority ownership stakes and dedicate substantial time and resources to guide, support and nurture our portfolio companies.

name: D-Ax Corporate Venture Capital
description: D-Ax is a partnership between Axel Johnson, a Swedish retail conglomerate and RECAPEX, a Nordic Investment company. Axel Johnson’s aim with D-ax is to invest in digital entrepreneurial companies. The ambition is to increase the trading group’s digital resources. As one of the Nordic region’s leading trading groups, Axel Johnson aims to meet with customers across all contact channels and develop new digital offers. The ambition is to is to increase the trading group’s digital resources. The firm looking for entrepreneurial digital companies that do business in trading and services. The companies should have achieved a certain level of sales and have a proven business model. While they may be e-commerce companies, this is not a must; they might also be companies that work with other digital business ideas within the spectrum covering online marketing, data transparency and data analysis.
fundingStage: Pre-Seed / Seed, Series A/B, Series C & Beyond

name: BillerudKorsnäs Venture
description: BillerudKorsnäs Venture invests in startups that will define tomorrow’s packaging solutions. We look for companies with financially and environmentally sustainable packaging products and services and a dedicated team. BillerudKorsnäs Venture is a wholly owned subsidiary of BillerudKorsnäs.
investmentAreas: Packaging Services, Paper Manufacturing, Venture Capital
fundingStage: Pre-Seed / Seed, Series A/B, Series C & Beyond

name: Collector Ventures
description: Collector Ventures is the investment vehicle of of Collector Bank, founded by Lena Apler.Collector Bank is a digital niche bank providing personal loans, credit cards, savings accounts, e-commerce payment solutions, factoring, and corporate lending with a strong emphasis on innovation and entrepreneurship.
investmentAreas: Financial Services, Sustainability, Complaint, Data protection
fundingStage: Pre-Seed / Seed, Series A/B, Series C & Beyond

name: Telia Ventures
description: Telia Ventures invests in consumer and enterprise markets focusing on cloud, mobile, and security. Telia Ventures looks for companies with the capability to become leaders in their segments. They invest in Series A and B rounds and their geographical focus is Northern Europe and other selected innovation hubs. Telia Ventures is the venture capital arm of Telia Company.
investmentAreas: Business Development, Consumer, Enterprise, Financial Services, Venture Capital

name: Bonnier Ventures
description: Launched as Bonnier Growth Media in 2013, Bonnier Ventures is the venture arm of media group Bonnier. As a financially driven corporate venture investor, they make minority investments in fast growing digital technology companies across multiple growth stages. Bonnier Capital is the investment division of the Bonnier Group, a Swedish based family owned group within media, publishing and real estate. The Bonnier Group has partnered with entrepreneurs for almost 200 years to enable innovation and the fostering of ideas and new businesses.
investmentAreas: Digital Media, Finance, Financial Services, Venture Capital, Investment
fundingStage: Pre-Seed / Seed, Series A/B, Series C & Beyond

name: MobilityXlab
description: MobilityXlab offers startups and emerging companies with pioneering ideas within mobility and connectivity the opportunity to accelerate with our six corporate partners: Ericsson, Magna, Polestar, Volvo Group, Zeekr Technology Europe and Zenseact. By offering a dedicated contact person to guide and access the partners competence, networks, tools and insights from leading subject matter experts, as well as workspace, we want to open the doors for companies ready to take on this challenge together with us. Together we will bring the future of mobility closer.
investmentAreas: Research Services, Automotive, Mobility, Connectivity, Artificial Intelligence

name: Husqvarna Ventures
description: Husqvarna Ventures is an corporate venture capital arm of Husqvarna Group.Husqvarna Group is a global leader in outdoor power products, garden watering products, and cutting equipment. Their range includes robotic lawnmowers, chainsaws, trimmers, and garden irrigation systems, all driven by a passion for innovation.
investmentAreas: Innovative outdoor power products, Garden watering products, Cutting equipment, Industries, Robotic Automowers

name: AxSol
description: AxSol makes investments in eminent businesses in the distributed energy industry. AxSol, the group's newest member, seeks to finance and support disruptive companies engaged in the solar energy industry.
fundingStage: Pre-Seed / Seed, Series A/B, Series C & Beyond

name: PINC
description: PINC was launched as Paulig Incubator in 2018 to help Paulig stay in the forefront of relevant innovations, as well as to contribute to a tastier, healthier and more sustainable planet. Today, our ambition is the same, but we have developed into a corporate venture arm. We aim for strategic, financial, and societal impact in our investments, fostering a sustainable food system for tomorrow. We are looking for entrepreneurs in an attractive market space with an intrinsic drive to find a solution to the problem they are addressing, a clear and scalable plan for success, a reliable team and partners whom we can trust and work closely with.
fundingStage: Pre-Seed / Seed, Series A/B, Series C & Beyond

name: H&M Group Ventures
description: H&M Group Ventures is the venture capital arm of the H&M Group. Founded in 1947, H&M Group is a global design company with ~4,702 stores in 76 markets and 56 online markets. At H&M Group, we believe in making great design available to everyone. It’s essential in everything we do. Our family of brands and business ventures offer customers around the world a wealth of fashion, beauty, accessories and homeware, as well as modern menus with fresh and local produce at some of the brands’ in-store eateries.
investmentAreas: Fashion, Design, Retail, Supply chain, Sustainability
fundingStage: Pre-Seed / Seed, Series A/B, Series C & Beyond

name: Volvo Group Venture Capital
description: Volvo Group Venture Capital is a corporate investment company making venture capital and growth equity investments. Their mission is to drive new business growth and their ambition is to be a leading corporate investor in sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions. Their value proposition to the companies we invest in, other investors as well as to our Volvo colleagues, is to accelerate growth.
investmentAreas: Finance, Venture Capital, Trucks, Construction Equipment, Buses
fundingStage: Pre-Seed / Seed, Series A/B, Series C & Beyond

name: Pophouse Ventures
description: Pophouse Ventures is the venture capital arm of Pophouse Entertainment.Pophouse Entertainment is a pioneering company that invests in intellectual property and develops entertainment brands in music, live entertainment, podcast, gaming, and hospitality.
investmentAreas: Live entertainment, Gaming, Hospitality, Music, Podcasts
fundingStage: Pre-Seed / Seed, Series A/B, Series C & Beyond

name: SSE Ventures
description: The early-stage venture capital firm of the Stockholm School of Economics. SSE Ventures is the early-stage venture capital fund of SSE Business Lab and the Stockholm School of Economics. The fund invests in startups admitted to the Incubate program, where they receive coaching, office space and access to a wide range of investors, partners and relevant expertise.
investmentAreas: E-Commerce, Financial Services, Information Technology, Internet, Software

name: SmiLe Incubator
description: SmiLe Incubator helps entrepreneurs and startup companies to develop and commercialize new ideas. Surrounded by smart and passionate people, as well as the best tools and approaches at your disposal – you’ll take leaps toward creating a business and connecting with the right people and resources. We offer business coaching, access to investor & industry networks, access to labs & instrument as well as a community with colleagues, friends and peers.
investmentAreas: Biotechnology, Life science, Medtech, Healthtech, Pharma

name: Norrsken Accelerator
description: Norrsken Accelerator is an Accelerator program. Norrsken supports founders with the knowledge, network and capital they need to make saving the world their business. We operate award-winning Norrsken House hubs in Stockholm, Sweden, Barcelona, Spain and Kigali, Rwanda.

name: Norrkoping Science Park
description: Norrkoping Science Park enables entrepreneurship and innovation for sustainable growth. We create waves of growth, competitiveness, and attractiveness in Norrköping with entrepreneurship, research-driven solutions, and societal impact at heart. Creating Positive Change.
investmentAreas: Matching, Education, Communication, Visualization, Printed electronics

name: Nicoya
description: Nicoya is a business-accelerating investment company focusing on foodtech. A foodtech investment company driven by creating meaningful impact on people, planet & health. Business-accelerating investment company focused on food tech, relentlessly driven by creating meaningful impact for people, planet & health. Nicoya is set on step-changing the future of foods.
investmentAreas: Foodtech, Investment, Impact investing, Growth, Consumer Insights

name: Sting
description: Sting enables talented people to turn their ideas into sustainable businesses. Sting enables talented people to turn their ideas into sustainable businesses. The support we offer includes qualified coaching in business development, a business angel network, a venture capital fund, a recruitment service, and an international network of investors, business contacts and experts.
investmentAreas: Sting enables talented people to turn their ideas into sustainable businesses. Sting enables talented people to turn their ideas into sustainable businesses. The support we offer includes qualified coaching in business development, a business angel network, a venture capital fund, a recruitment service, and an international network of investors, business contacts and experts.

name: Unboxx
description: Unboxx operates as a business lab dedicated to fostering creativity and growth in startups. We provide a dynamic environment for entrepreneurs to develop, test, and refine their ideas. At Unboxx, we empower visionary businesses to reach their full potential through strategic support and collaboration.

name: SUP46
description: Startup Hub providing its members with competitive advantage through the world-class ecosystem. Also open meeting place for the community. For over a decade, we have been inspiring, educating, and empowering founders, providing them with a network and resources to supercharge their growth and improve the startup ecosystem. Our milestones speak to our shared ambition. Over 300 startups have grown through our ranks, raising a staggering +$1Bn in venture capital. With 25+ exits & IPOs, we're just getting started.

name: Eureka Partners
description: Eureka Partners promotes an open-minded and innovative culture, challenging established ideas and seeking fresh solutions. Eureka Partners is a Web3.0 advisory, incubation and investment firm that guide startup projects, SMEs and MNCs to the crypto world. Our team comes from a diverse background including investment banking, venture capital, management consulting and successful Web3.0 entrepreneurship and working experiences.
investmentAreas: Business Consulting, Services Industry, Consulting, Professional Services

name: Fast Track Malmo
description: Helping amazing teams accelerate their growth and raise their first VC round. We invest a €50k in 10 different startups a year. Based in Malmö, Southern Sweden, our accelerator has been voted the best accelerator program in Sweden and is one of the highest quality accelerator programs in Europe. Fast Track Malmö offers a 3-month program including €50k of investment as a convertible note.
investmentAreas: Entrepreneurship, Ecosystem building, Mentoring, Venture capital

name: LEVELS – The Venture Studio
description: Levels venture studio builds excellent ideas into successful businesses by co-founding, investing, and sharing both risk and upside. Levels is a Nordic venture studio that creates, builds, and invests in brilliant digital businesses with an offering that covers all aspects of digital transformation. Founded in 2016 with a vision to develop unique and differentiated products, services, and ventures based on cutting-edge tech, Levels continuously shares risk and upside with clients and partners while delivering innovation, long-term value creation and impact.
investmentAreas: Consulting, Marketing, Software, Web Design, Web Development

name: Uppsala Innovation Centre
description: The company offers well-defined processes to help startups develop their innovations. Its mission is to increase the number of successful high-growth companies within the Uppsala region.
investmentAreas: Professional Training, Coaching, Business Development, Network, Management Support

name: LEAD
description: LEAD our objective is to accelerate the development of start-ups by providing idea bringers and entrepreneurs. We have tools for success when you need to build companies in tech - from startups to growth companies. LEAD is a business incubator that has supported hundreds of promising startups in Östergötland.
investmentAreas: Entrepreneurship, Start-ups, Business Development, Lean, Proffessional Coaching

name: DigitalWell Ventures
description: DigitalWell Ventures is an accelerator firm that invests in digital health tech and welfare companies. Accelerator for Nordic and Baltic Health Tech Startups / Startup Program Developer for Innovation Ecosystem Actors. We develop founder oriented accelerator programs supporting our startup teams with company building, preparing to raise capital by raising their investor readiness and accelerate their network and market traction for scaling and growth.
investmentAreas: Accelerator, Investor, Innovation, Health Tech, Finance

name: Krinova
description: Krinova, an incubator and science park, offers meeting spaces, arranges tailor-made conferences, and promotes innovations and development. Krinova helps to build a thriving business climate, a Sweden of the future where entrepreneurs realise ideas and reach their full potential. Krinova´s profile area is food. We strive to be a strong voice for innovation and entreprenurship in the food sector in Sweden and in the Nordic region.

name: Yuncture Invest
description: Our platform facilitates meaningful connections, mentorship, and investment opportunities to empower startups for sustainable growth. At Yuncture Invest, we foster collaboration and innovation, bridging the gap between visionaries and resources essential for entrepreneurial success

name: Framtidens Foretag
description: Framtidens Foretag(Future Enterprises) is a business incubator. We are Founders Loft, an incubator that supports and promotes entrepreneurship with a sustainable focus in the Västra Götaland region. By providing business development and knowledge development activities for companies both established and newly started. Founders Loft develops startup companies into sustainable growth companies in digital services.
investmentAreas: Saas startups, Business incubator, Realizing ideas, Entrepreneurs, Coaching

name: WhaleShark
description: weXelerate is an Europe's smartest startup & innovation hub.fostering cutting-edge ideas and collaboration. We provide startups with access to mentorship, resources, and a vibrant ecosystem to accelerate growth. At weXelerate, we cultivate innovation and drive forward-thinking solutions that shape the future of various industries.
investmentAreas: Investment Management, Crowdfunding, Insurance, Financial Services

name: Walerud Ventures
description: Wincanton is a leading third party logistics (3PL) and supply chain solutions provider in the UK and Ireland. We work in industry sectors as diverse as defence, milk, energy, retail, consumer goods and construction, supporting customers at every stage of their development. Whether they are a small niche retailer, a growing brand
investmentAreas: Advanced Materials, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Biotechnology, CleanTech, GreenTech

name: Hatchbay
description: We remove early stage obstacles by providing a tech team, funding and business advice from successful entrepreneurs. We empower you to build something people really want and then help you get alot of people to use your service. All startups take part in our 6 month program where we co-build your product.
investmentAreas: Venture Capital, Private Equity Principals, Funding

name: Chromia Innovation Lab
description: Chromia Innovation Lab, the creators of the groundbreaking relational blockchain technology, has officially launched its second annual Incubation Program, designed to help blockchain entrepreneurs, developers, and designers bring their startup ideas to life on the Chromia platform. Chromia is a platform that is both a blockchain and a relational database, built with both developers and end-users in mind. Chromia by ChromaWay is a public relational blockchain platform powered by #Rell.
investmentAreas: Blockchain technology, Financial Services, Gaming, Web3

name: Arctic Business
description: Arctic Business is a business incubator that assists startups and businesses with teams, funding, and growth. Arctic Business finds and expands extraordinary ideas into successful international businesses on an international market solving important problems. We connect founders with the right team, money, partners and customers.

name: Nxt2b
description: NXT2B is a fully privately owned venture capital company capable of making fast investment decisions without requiring external capital. The NXT2B team has proven experience in commercializing innovative projects and partners with competent and ambitious entrepreneurs, focusing on growth equity investments in healthcare, medical devices, and specialty pharmaceutical companies. They are prepared to invest in early-phase projects of high scientific quality and reasonable business potential, as well as in technology and consumer companies with unique ideas. Since its inception in 2011, NXT2B has invested in over 30 companies, offering active support to portfolio management teams to build market-leading companies.

name: +Cap
description: Impact Investment Company focusing on high-impact early-stage startups - Backing the world's most promising high-impact startups www.pluscap.se Investments include www.worldish.se and www.woshapp.se

name: Klimatet Invest
description: Klimatet Invest invests early in companies in the Nordics with disruptive technologies that significantly contribute to a sustainable future. Its primary investment focus is on the energy system of the future, centering on wind, solar, hydrogen, and climate-smart energy storage. Klimatet Invest is headquartered in Gothenburg.
investmentAreas: Energy, Renewables, Green Hydrogen, Clean Tech

name: All Generation Ventures
description: AGV (All Generation Ventures) is the Nordic PropTech platform connecting entrepreneurs, investors, and stakeholders. Its mission is to create the best environment for scaling Nordic PropTech companies. AGV's ecosystem acts as a link between PropTech startups and leading real estate companies, accelerating the digitalization of the Nordic real estate industry.
investmentAreas: PropTech, Circular Economy, Waste Management, Property Management

name: Tigrim
description: Tigrim is a statement, a feeling and a sense of belonging. We believe in people and their visions, helping them grow into sustainable companies. We focus on people and the bright ideas that power our future.

name: Ocean Impact
description: Founded on a passion for the oceans and a commitment to making a difference, Ocean Impact is the Sweden-based investment firm of Fredrik Lind and Robin Ramm-Ericson. Ocean Impact aspires to support entrepreneurs and promising tech companies to fulfill their vision. Fredrik brings 25 years of experience serving technology companies and private equity investors as Senior Partner first at McKinsey & Co. in Singapore, and then at BCG in Stockholm, where he also led ocean policy and sustainability work as areas of expertise. The entrepreneur and unicorn-builder Robin leverages a deep passion for tech and ocean with his experience in actively building tech companies from the first idea to IPO and beyond. As an active owner and partner, Ocean Impact invests in and supports the scaling of tech companies with ocean impact.

name: 20 North Street
description: We focus on healthcare companies within pharma, biotech, medical technology and health care services and; technology companies within software and hardware. We are primarily interested when the capital and competence we add are required for product or market development. We make investments in companies which are still small and where we can make a difference as owners. We invest in several rounds of financing but limit our initial investment to SEK 10 million. We are looking for a high return which typically is achieved through and exit within 3-5 years. Our investors make a difference for the companies we invest in through the board.
investmentAreas: Healthcare companies within pharma, biotech, medical technology and health care services and; technology companies within software and hardware.

name: Cryptowell
description: Cryptowell invests in companies, startups, and projects related to fintech and blockchain technology. Based in Stockholm, Sweden, Cryptowell is an atypical venture capital firm that emerged from the craft of mining Litecoin. Its investment philosophy is to invest in people and companies that share its view, belief, and passion for blockchain technology.

name: Enexis AB
description: Enexis AB invest in companies involved in plant-based medical, wellness and industrial applications, notably cannabis and hemp. They invest in companies that aim to improve lives of millions of people while delivering financial returns for the investors.

name: Aligned
description: Aligned invests from the pre-seed/seed stage through early growth stages, without focusing on any specific sectors. The firm brings meaningful investment experience, a diverse support network, and a committed partnership to enable founders of all kinds to realize their vision.

name: Walerud Ventures
description: Walerud Ventures joins pre-seed and seed stage companies as investors, advisors and part-time employees. Deep tech that is planet-positive. Nordic, deep tech, pre-seed projects for the living planet
investmentAreas: Nordic, deep tech, green tech, sustainability, fintech, AI

name: Northislet
description: The Nordic region is at the forefront of the technology and scientific revolution. Northislet's vision is to help create and build Nordic champions within Life Science, allowing them to grow and reach their potential in the hands of local entrepreneurs, employees, and shareholders. Their goal is to create long-term value for all stakeholders, fostering a prosperous environment for new and existing companies, entrepreneurs, and scientists, making the Nordic region a competitive and attractive place for global talent within Life Science. Northislet aims to become a leading Nordic investment company in Life Science over the next 25 years, with the journey just beginning.

name: Red Pill VC
description: Red Pill Invest is a boutique venture capital firm based in Stockholm. We invest in awesome companies and proudly support founders in accelerating growth. Our focus areas are Tech and Health Care. Together with our investor network, we provide more than just capital. We provide smart capital.

name: Immetric
description: ImImmetric Invest is a boutique investment fund specializing in high-potential deep tech startups in Europe. They prioritize the importance of patents and patent strategy in building successful companies. Through hands-on operational involvement, Immetric Invest develops tailored, data-driven IP strategies for their portfolio companies, aiming to enhance success rates and maximize shareholder value from foundation to IPO.
investmentAreas: Deep Tech, Automotive, Manufacturing, Health Diagnostics

name: Devotion Ventures
description: Devotion Ventures is a micro VC fund focused on supporting and investing in early-stage B2B SaaS companies led by courageous entrepreneurs driven to make a significant impact globally. Founded by the creators of Minna Technologies and Adfenix, Devotion Ventures brings firsthand experience in scaling operational teams to over 100 employees and achieving annual revenues exceeding 100 MSEK across more than 10 markets. The fund is bolstered by the support of prominent backers like Alexander Hars, Magnus Emilsson, and Kim Olsson. Devotion Ventures has already made impactful investments in companies such as HomeQ, AllaBRF, Stockrepublic, and Näktergal, positioning itself at the forefront of nurturing transformative startups.

name: Carl Westin
description: Carl Westin is an international investment company. They invest in great people with big ideas. Industry agnostic-

name: Njord Ventures
description: Njord Ventures is a seed and early-stage venture capital investor specializing in Swedish entrepreneurial companies. The firm seeks out inspirational entrepreneurs with scalable business models that demonstrate exceptional growth potential driven by technology, macro trends, and disruptions. Njord Ventures prioritizes investing in exceptional individuals who exhibit the determination to achieve extraordinary results.

name: Nordic Game Ventures
description: Nordic Game Ventures specializes in investing exclusively in early-stage game development and games ecosystem SME companies across the Nordic region (Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway, and Sweden). The firm focuses on companies that demonstrate outstanding team competence, exceptional content, and a robust market approach. Their portfolio strategy emphasizes diversification and balance, supporting startups through to follow-on investments across various subsectors. Nordic Game Ventures adopts a disciplined, no-leverage approach to fund composition and risk management. As a local, sector-specific expert, Nordic Game Ventures serves as a super-connector and co-investor with a vested interest in the Nordic games industry, making it an attractive partner for global investors seeking opportunities in this dynamic sector.

name: Norrsken Launcher
description: Rooted in the Norrsken Foundation, the fund is an early-stage deep tech impact (Article 9) investor that offers access to impact capital, world-class recruitment resources, and scalable growth structures. With a focused strategy, the fund makes 1-3 selective investments per year and takes a deeply operational approach, working closely alongside founders to drive growth and achieve impactful outcomes.
investmentAreas: Deep Tech, Impact, GreenTech, CleanTech, AgTech

name: Halland Invest
description: The investment firm focuses on early-stage and growth-oriented companies located primarily within the region. They seek businesses with scalable ideas and clear competitive advantages, led by driven entrepreneurs willing to take significant risks. Emphasizing sustainability, they assess teams based on their diverse skills and experience. Investments are made through equity, convertible debentures, or Crown loans, with a preference for initiatives linked to growth in Halland and collaborations with Halmstad University. Initial investments typically start at SEK 500,000, with a maximum amount per company limited to one additional investment. Crown loans are offered up to SEK 500,000 annually per company, capped at SEK 250,000. Their investment strategy includes planning for potential exits within a six-year timeframe.

name: Futurology Ventures
description: Operational early stage investor Pre-seed to Series A. Focus on Climate Tech and Impact. Collaborating with VCs, Syndicates and Accelerators. We actively invest in Pre-Seed to Series A in passionate teams that are looking to scale. Focus on Nordic and Baltic impact and ClimateTech ideas.
investmentAreas: Climate Tech, Impact Investing, Sustainability, Circular Economy

name: Crosslight Partners
description: Crosslight Partners tackles substantial challenges within the food system with innovative solutions. These companies are at the early growth stage, demonstrating commercial traction. Investments typically range from SEK 1 to 10 million, with flexible ownership stakes. While the focus is global, emphasis lies on the Nordics and Europe. The investment horizon spans 3 to 7 years, and governance involvement includes securing a board seat or holding quarterly follow-up meetings.

name: Quinary Investment
description: Quinary Investment AB is a Stockholm-based investment company focused on long-term value creation through investments in both private and public technology companies, with a focus on B2B.

name: E14 Invest
description: E14 Invest is a co-investment company based in Åre that invests in scalable growth companies with connections to the region along the European route E14, from Sundsvall to Trondheim. The goal is to favor entrepreneurship in the region while making long-term sustainable investments with good returns for our investors. We also make a smaller percentage of investments outside the region when it is particularly interesting.

name: Confidus Venture Capital
description: Confidus Venture Capital is a venture fund designed to outperform. It invests in future winners in digital transformation and automation.

name: First Venture
description: First Venture invests in strong entrepreneurial teams in technology, health and sustainability. First Venture invests in both unlisted and listed growth companies with a market cap lower than SEK 500 million. The investor team led by Rune Nordlander and Peter Werme together has a long, relevant and unique experience of investing in both listed and unlisted companies in technology, health and sustainability. First Venture is a long-term, active owner and works closely with the entrepreneurial teams in the portfolio companies.

name: Beijer Ventures
description: Confidus Venture Capital, part of the family-owned Beijer Holding, invests in digital transformation and automation. Beijer Holding also includes Beijerinvest and holds a controlling stake in Beijer Alma, an international component manufacturing and industrial trade group. Additionally, Beijer Holding supports various organizations focused on entrepreneurship, research, and education, such as the Anders Walls Foundation and the Beijer Institute. Confidus Venture Capital seeks companies with stable ownership, development progress, and strong entrepreneurial cultures to achieve significant growth.

name: RP Ventures
description: "RP Ventures is a nordic seed and early stage investment company primarily focusing in the technology space. We add hands on management competences and financial resources to pursue growth and realise value. Examples of current and previous holdings include: Mestro AB (listed at Nasdaq First North) AAC Clyde Space AB (listed at Nasdaq First North) Rolling Optics AB (listed at Nasdaq First North) Byredo AB (sold to Manzanita Capital)"

name: Starbright Invest
description: Starbright Invest focuses on investing in entrepreneur-led, scalable companies with the potential for significant growth, particularly in technology and digital innovation that promotes sustainable development. We are actively committed to supporting our portfolio companies and aim for investments of €0.5-1.5 million.

name: Astrec Invest
description: They partner with entrepreneurs and scientists who challenge conventional thinking and tackle complex problems. Their focus is on investing in innovative solutions with the potential to disrupt market structures. They prioritize businesses that embody agility, scalability, and sustainability in their operations and growth strategies.

name: SEB Greentech Venture Capital
description: SEB Greentech Venture Capital specializes in green technology investments, targeting transformative ideas with significant potential to reduce greenhouse gas emissions or mitigate planetary boundary challenges. They focus on hardware, software, and technology platform solutions across sectors such as renewable energy, energy storage, water and agricultural technology, circular business models, and waste management.
investmentAreas: Green Tech, Renewables, Energy Storage, AgTech

name: Ampli Ventures
description: Ampli Ventures is a venture capital investment company focused on rapidly expanding SaaS companies in their early stages. They maintain a long-term investment horizon without mandated exit timelines. Their team is founder-friendly, boasting experience from prominent tech firms. They offer a network of SaaS founders and investors as valuable sparring partners. Additionally, they possess the capability to support growth beyond Series A with their extensive investor community connections.
investmentAreas: SaaS, Software as a Service, Cloud

name: Bonit Capital
description: Bonit Capital, a Swedish family-owned investment company, engages in diverse sectors and asset classes, including social investments and outcome models. In Venture Capital, Bonit focuses on life sciences, providing capital and industry expertise to ambitious founders in digital health, medical technology, and diagnostics.
investmentAreas: Life Sciences, Digital health, Medtech, Diagnostics

name: MOOR
description: Based in Stockholm, Sweden, the firm's portfolio spans investments in both public and private companies. Specializing in digital innovation, they focus on transformative technologies with a global impact, particularly strengthening their presence in the Nordics. Their private equity investments are characterized by a long-term perspective, prioritizing support for invested teams without predefined exit horizons. They adopt an active ownership approach, leveraging the proven experience and track record of their senior team in entrepreneurial ventures and specialized industries. Partnering closely with portfolio companies, they collaborate to enhance business capabilities and drive sustainable growth.

name: Linc AB
description: Linc invests in product oriented companies in the Nordic Life Science industry – primarily in pharmaceutical and medical technology companies. Their investments in drug development usually take place at an early stage, while investments in medical technology are made in more mature businesses.

name: Gullspång Invest
description: Gullspång Invest funds entrepreneurial teams addressing global challenges with commercial solutions, aiming to transform systems into more resilient states. They prioritize true value over exits and plan with a long-term perspective, focusing on the next generation rather than short-term gains. Purpose-driven and profit-oriented, they seek enduring partnerships with entrepreneurs who share their passion. Their investment portfolio includes companies such as Mat.se, Oatly, N!CK’S, Färsking, Baseload Capital, Climeon, Trine, Vilokan, and Axis Communications.

name: Nineyards Equity
description: The investor focuses on scaling tech-enabled and consumer internet companies from Series A and beyond, investing between EUR 2-15 million initially. They prioritize "more mature tech companies" with over EUR 5 million in revenue or ARR, strong annual growth, profitability, and a resilient, scalable business model. Emphasizing market leadership and additional growth potential, they seek teams with proven capabilities and a commitment to positive ESG impacts for superior financial returns.
investmentAreas: EV, Fintech, Logistics, Blockchain, Data, Cybersecurity

name: Curitas Ventures
description: Curitas Ventures is a Stockholm based VC, launched by Mikael Ahlström and Gerda Larsson in 2020. We invest in teams determined to build something out of the ordinary within the field of Disruptive Tech and Life Science.
investmentAreas: Disruptive Technology, Life Science and Sustainability.

name: Webrock Ventures
description: Webrock Ventures operates as a Venture Studio specializing in creating tech companies through a unique venture-building approach. Their mission centers on developing digital enterprises that positively impact the daily lives of Brazilians. By partnering with leading technology firms in the Nordic region, they integrate proven business models with funding capabilities and operational expertise. This collaboration enables their portfolio companies to gain a significant advantage, accelerating value creation while mitigating risks. As active owners, they prioritize delivering both shareholder and social value, emphasizing the establishment of sustainable, long-term businesses. Founded in 2018, Webrock Ventures is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, and São Paulo, Brazil.

name: DHS Venture Partners
description: To DHS we bring decades of experience in entrepreneurship. Between our partners and alumni, we have founded and built companies with an accumulated valuation of >15 billion sek, held board seats at companies such as Altor, Kinnevik, Nasdaq, and invested in >120 companies across industries.
investmentAreas: Software, Big Data, SaaS, ML, Ecommerce

name: Axilium Holding
description: Axilium Holding was established in Gothenburg, Sweden in 2018. Empowered with significant investment experience in several fields, a wide professional network, and a strong desire to succeed, the two founders established an innovative investment company focusing on early stage Technology and Life Science companies based predominantly in Europe.
investmentAreas: Life Sciences, Semiconductor, Biotech, Software, MedTech

name: East Hill Equity
description: Scania Growth Capital is the hybrid venture capital fund powered by Scania and managed by East Hill Equity. East Hill Equity is an experienced start-up investor with years of experience in different industries, who firmly believes that the relationship with their founders is the key asset. With offices in Stockholm and Berlin, East Hill Equity works with a flexible and fair investment approach on a long term basis, supporting companies during their growth.
investmentAreas: B2B, Intelligent Automation, Photonics, AI, Microchips

name: Mist Ventures
description: Mist Ventures specializes in investing in technology-driven companies, particularly those in deep tech sectors with proprietary technology that offers a competitive edge. Their focus areas include embedded software, hardware, ASIC, telecom, machine learning, and algorithms, where they leverage strong technological and industry expertise. With investments up to 1M SEK, Mist Ventures actively engages with portfolio companies to maximize their benefit from the team's experience. They target scalable technology ventures in the pre-seed and seed stages, aiming for significant international market opportunities. Their investments prioritize businesses with sustainable long-term potential built on future-proof technologies.
investmentAreas: Deep Tech, embedded software, hardware, ASIC, telecom, machine learning, and algorithms

name: LRF Ventures
description: LRF Ventures, operated by the Federation of Swedish Farmers (LRF), is dedicated to fostering innovation within the agricultural and forestry sectors in Sweden. They believe that innovative startups with smart, sustainable solutions can significantly contribute to growth and profitability in Swedish agriculture. LRF Ventures emphasizes the importance of a robust agricultural system as foundational to building a sustainable society for the future.

name: Course Corrected
description: Course Corrected is a stage agnostic fund with a primary focus on seed stages and Series A rounds, with potential to invest selectively in later stages in special opportunities. Course Corrected is backing outstanding entrepreneurs and teams with fast growing and scalable businesses that drive the transformation towards climate positive alternatives, disrupting incumbents and with the potential to become leaders in their respective markets.
investmentAreas: Pet Food, Alternative Proteins, Green Hydrogen, Sustainability, Impact Investing

name: Proptech Farm
description: PropTech Farm accelerates startups in PropTech and Real Estate, focusing on SaaS, Data & AI, IoT, Sustainable Energy, and Transaction tech. They invest in Nordic and Southeast Asian companies with global growth potential, guiding founders and teams with coaching and network access.
investmentAreas: Property, Tech, and PropTech, SaaS, Data, AI

name: Partnerinvest Norr
description: Partnerinvest Norr is a venture capital firm operating in Norr- and Västerbotten, established in 2010 through Norrlandsfonden and Almi Invest. They specialize in investing in companies with scalable business models and driven entrepreneurs across diverse industries. Unlike typical venture capital firms, Partnerinvest Norr focuses on northern Sweden and collaborates with private investment partners to provide substantial capital and extensive networks. Their Investment Managers bring extensive regional industry knowledge and experience in equity capital investments.

name: The Case for Her
description: The Case for Her is a global blended-finance investment portfolio addressing the key women’s health issues of menstruation and female sexual health through grants, investments, convenings, and advocacy. Founded in 2017, The Case for Her brings together over 30 years of experience working and investing in women’s health and rights. This dynamic and flexible portfolio spans the globe and includes investments in product companies, tech innovations, research initiatives, and grassroots organizations.
investmentAreas: Femtech, Reproductive Health , Impact Investing, SexTech

name: RYMD Kapital
description: Rymdkapital is a pioneering venture capital firm based in Sweden, specializing in Spacetech investments across the Nordics and Europe. They focus on supporting visionary entrepreneurs tackling commercial needs and global challenges within the expanding space economy. With extensive experience in both space industry dynamics and early-stage investing, Rymdkapital aims to accelerate startup growth from initial funding to later stages, leveraging their deep industry insights and strategic connections.
investmentAreas: Satellite Systems, Space Communications, Propulsion Systems, Space Tech

name: Talent Venture Group
description: Talent Venture Group (TVG) is a rapidly expanding investor and venture builder in the HR and Talent Tech sector, focused on empowering founders to create innovative companies that enhance talent management. They bring specialized knowledge across recruitment, engagement, and performance to drive sustainable impact in HR practices. With ambitions to lead globally in their field, TVG has already invested in over 20 HR and Talent Tech startups, achieving 6 successful exits. Their current portfolio includes diverse companies like Talent Inc, Nova, NyTeknik, and others, positioning TVG as a key player in shaping the future of HR technology.

name: LIU Invest
description: LiU Invest invests in companies oriented toward commercializing ideas and results connected to Linköping University. This means we contribute to innovative companies in ways that bring added values to the University as well as in strengthening the attractiveness of the region. LiU Invest is part of LiU Holding AB, owned by Linköping University. An important part of LiU Holding’s mission is to, at an early stage, make investments in research associated companies. This is done by LiU Invest.

name: RightBridge Ventures
description: Their mission is to accelerate sustainable growth in gaming and esports, aiming to make global wealth accessible to all stakeholders: investors, players, fans, and companies. Their objectives include contributing to the global expansion of the esports and gaming industries, maximizing sustainable returns on investment in their portfolio companies, promoting fairness in wealth distribution across the industry's value chain, and advocating for gender equality within esports.

name: Kale United
description: They are a public holding company focused on impact investments in pioneering plant-based and foodtech companies. Their investments are diversified and aimed at scalable R&D and production. Kale United's holdings are designed to accelerate the shift to a more plant-based lifestyle and reduce the carbon footprint of food.
investmentAreas: Foodtech, Alternative proteins, Supply Chain, Pet Food, Agtech

name: Creandum
description: Creandum, founded after the dotcom bubble and having thrived through the 2008/9 economic crisis, continues to invest steadily despite recent market conditions, believing top founders can emerge anytime. They've witnessed significant growth in the European tech market over 20 years. Now, they proudly announce the closing of Creandum VII, a €500m fund to support Europe's top Seed and Series A startups. Their disciplined, generalist approach focuses on partnering with the best entrepreneurs to build future global, category-defining companies.

name: Creandum
description: Creandum, founded after the dotcom bubble and having thrived through the 2008/9 economic crisis, continues to invest steadily despite recent market conditions, believing top founders can emerge anytime. They've witnessed significant growth in the European tech market over 20 years. Now, they proudly announce the closing of Creandum VII, a €500m fund to support Europe's top Seed and Series A startups. Their disciplined, generalist approach focuses on partnering with the best entrepreneurs to build future global, category-defining companies.

name: Norrsken VC
description: Founded in Sweden in 2017 by four impact capitalists, Norrsken VC is the venture capital arm of the non-profit Norrsken Foundation, aiming to channel more capital to entrepreneurs building impactful businesses. With a pragmatic, results-driven approach, Norrsken VC supports the top 1% of startups in the impact space, including an increasing number of Unicorns, contributing to worldwide impact.

name: Norrsken VC
description: Founded in Sweden in 2017 by four impact capitalists, Norrsken VC is the venture capital arm of the non-profit Norrsken Foundation, aiming to channel more capital to entrepreneurs building impactful businesses. With a pragmatic, results-driven approach, Norrsken VC supports the top 1% of startups in the impact space, including an increasing number of Unicorns, contributing to worldwide impact.

name: Kinnevik
description: They are on a mission to redefine industries and create new categories. As an entrepreneurial investor, active owner, and operational partner, they support challenger companies in Europe and the US. With a permanent capital structure, they invest to rapidly scale future market leaders in healthcare, software, marketplaces, and climate tech. They back ideas, founders, and companies that simplify everyday life globally. They invest in products and services that offer better choices and solutions to pressing issues. Committed to creating long-term value, they engage at all stages of a company’s growth journey.
investmentAreas: Healthcare, software, marketplaces and climate tech.

name: Creandum
description: Creandum, founded after the dotcom bubble and having thrived through the 2008/9 economic crisis, continues to invest steadily despite recent market conditions, believing top founders can emerge anytime. They've witnessed significant growth in the European tech market over 20 years. Now, they proudly announce the closing of Creandum VII, a €500m fund to support Europe's top Seed and Series A startups. Their disciplined, generalist approach focuses on partnering with the best entrepreneurs to build future global, category-defining companies.

name: Luminar Ventures
description: Luminar is the most active pre-seed and seed-stage VC fund in Sweden. Their focus now extends globally as they seek out future-forward technologies and business models, supporting top-tier founders primarily in the Nordic region.

name: Chalmers Ventures AB
description: They are a prominent deep tech investor and venture builder in the Nordics, specializing in commercializing innovations from research labs. Their unique model integrates venture creation and tech investments, leveraging Chalmers’ entrepreneurial ecosystem to identify and nurture high-potential deep tech opportunities with commercial and societal impact. They actively start and support companies based on cutting-edge research, playing a pivotal role from investment through to exit. Profits are reinvested to sustain their evergreen model, funding further groundbreaking research at Chalmers University.

name: J12
description: They support entrepreneurs who are developing solutions for the AI era, focusing on founders creating technically sophisticated data and AI tools, as well as AI-native applications. Above all, they prioritize founders who demonstrate exceptional creativity, insatiable curiosity, and unwavering determination to succeed.

name: Industrifonden
description: They invest in early-stage companies from seed to A-round and sometimes earlier, with initial investments typically ranging from 10-50 million SEK. Their evergreen fund structure allows them to prioritize long-term value over short-term gains. They focus on unique, scalable innovations that can have a meaningful societal impact, led by passionate founders capable of driving industry-changing ideas to fruition.
investmentAreas: Deep Tech, Life Sciences, Transformative Tech

name: VNV Global
description: VNV Global is an experienced and opportunistic investor known for backing business models with strong competitive advantages, particularly focusing on network effect businesses over the past decade. They provide patient capital to scalable tech companies worldwide, supporting mission-driven entrepreneurs tackling substantial challenges through innovative solutions. Based in Stockholm and Cyprus, VNV Global is publicly listed on NASDAQ Stockholm's Mid Cap segment under the ticker VNV.

name: Prima Materia
description: They aim to partner with exceptional individuals to build technology-driven companies that solve important societal problems. Acting as active owners rather than mere investors, they focus on a small number of enterprises for long-term success. Their philosophy emphasizes Europe's ability to attract top talent globally and their commitment to fostering companies that lead in critical areas of societal impact. Founder is Daniel Ek, Founder and Chairman of Spotify.

name: Trill Impact
description: Trill Impact operates as a dedicated Impact House focused exclusively on impact investments. Their unique design ensures that all investments are aimed at generating positive returns while making significant impacts on people, the planet, and investors alike.
investmentAreas: Green Tech, Life Sciences, Impact Investing

name: SEB Venture Capital
description: SEB Venture Capital, a leading Fintech investor in the Nordics since 1995, aims to create sustainable, long-term value through strategic investments in innovative companies. They prioritize strong management teams and seek transformative technologies that enhance the financial industry's intelligence, safety, sustainability, and user experience. Their partnerships offer access to extensive international networks, specialized expertise, and robust financial resources within SEB.

name: HealthCap
description: HealthCap is a European venture capital firm investing globally in life sciences and has raised eight funds since 1996. HealthCap has backed and built more than 127 companies, taken more than 45 companies public, and completed numerous trade sales. The investment strategy focuses on diseases with a high unmet medical need and breakthrough therapies that have the potential to be transformative, change clinical practice, and change the lives of patients suffering from these conditions.

name: Schibsted
description: Schibsted Marketplaces, renowned for its leading brands in the Nordics, is reshaping consumer consumption patterns across goods and services. Recently, the company underwent a split into two distinct entities. Concerning the division, their business focuses on developing marketplaces within four primary sectors – Mobility, Recommerce, Real Estate, and Jobs – pivotal elements within the circular economy.

name: BackingMinds
description: €50m Nordic pre-seed/seed fund, backing great underinvested entrepreneurs (€500K-€3m tickets). They champion an innovative approach to business, focusing on overlooked opportunities and backing high-performing founders beyond traditional venture capital networks. Their commitment to backing extends beyond financial support, emphasizing proactive engagement and collaborative partnerships with founders, characterized by genuine care and dedication.

name: LongRun Capital
description: They seek early-stage companies with significant climate impact potential and strong financial returns. Diversity in team composition or clear goals to enhance diversity are crucial criteria. While they focus on Nordic legal entities, they target markets beyond the region. Their investment stage preference is seed and pre-seed, typically offering SEK 5 – 20 million with ownership stakes ranging from 10% to 30%.
investmentAreas: Financial Services, Impact Investing, Venture Capital

name: Spintop Ventures
description: Spintop Ventures is an early-stage venture capital firm specializing in technology investments, particularly in software-based companies from the Nordics. Since 2010, they have successfully invested in companies like Small Giant Games, MariaDB Corporation, and Crosser Technologies, several of which have been acquired by major global technology leaders. Their focus is on fostering these companies to become industry leaders and promoting long-term sustainability in society.

name: Wellstreet
description: Wellstreet Ventures' Ventures II Fund continues their successful approach from their first fund, targeting early-stage startups in D2C, B2B, SaaS, and product sectors. They prioritize diverse founders with strong commercial acumen and a growth mindset. Key investment criteria include enhancing customer experience, utilizing data-driven models, and adhering to proactive ESG standards. They focus on startups poised for mainstream adoption, ensuring strategic early-stage investments.
investmentAreas: Fintech, E-commerce, Martech, Health, PropTech, RegTech, SportsTech, Sweden only

name: Inbox Capital
description: Inbox Capital, based in Stockholm, Sweden, is a family-owned investment company specializing in disruptive and rapidly expanding technology sectors such as Fintech, Medtech, E-sports, B2B SaaS, and Deep Social Networks. Leveraging their own experience in building global businesses, they prioritize strong entrepreneurial leadership and persistence in the companies they invest in. They offer not just capital but also strategic advice and access to a broad network. With a focus on companies demonstrating a solid business model and significant growth metrics, their portfolio includes around 50 notable companies like VOI, Revolut, Truecaller, Meds, Acast, and Fishbrain.
investmentAreas: Fintech, Medtech, E-sports, B2B SaaS and Deep Social Networks.

name: Gullspång Re:food
description: They are a for-profit, evergreen investment firm active across two continents, specializing in empowering entrepreneurs to address crucial challenges in the food system for future generations. Since 2015, they have focused on investing in initiatives driving the green transition of the food system. Their team collectively boasts over two decades of leadership experience in the food industry.
investmentAreas: Food, Sustainable proteins, Alternative proteins, Supply Chain, Digital Health, Agtech

name: Nordic Makers
description: They aim to establish a novel investor approach akin to angel investing, characterized by founder-friendly terms and streamlined communication. They prioritize quick, direct conversations over bureaucratic reporting, positioning themselves as peers rather than authoritative figures. Their preference is to lead seed rounds ranging from above $500k to below $2m, with the goal of guiding startups towards Series A funding. They look for teams with strong foundations and a promising product, backed by initial traction metrics. While monetization isn't a prerequisite, they seek startups capable of discussing a path towards achieving $100m in annual revenue.

name: Mudcake
description: Mudcake is a microfund managed by former founders committed to improving the world for future generations. They specialize in investing in exceptional founders who are revolutionizing food production, distribution, and consumption. Typically, they invest between $200k and $800k in pre-seed and seed rounds worldwide.
investmentAreas: Foodtech, Alternative proteins, Supply Chain, Pet Food, Agtech

name: Centripetal
description: They strive to expand access to capital beyond traditional boundaries. Their focus lies in investing in rapidly expanding and profitable European enterprises. Acting as proactive stakeholders, they facilitate connections with robust capital markets, fostering mutual growth and development.

name: LU Innovation
description: LU Innovation offers diverse funding opportunities tailored to support research-based innovation projects. They provide grants such as Verification for Collaboration (VFS) and Verification for Growth (VFT), aimed at fostering collaborations and validating business concepts. Additionally, they offer accelerator investments to expedite market entry for promising ventures. Students can benefit from test support grants and Leapfrogs scholarships to explore and develop business ideas. LU Innovation also facilitates equity capital investments through LU Holding, focusing on scalable ventures with strong growth potential and capable teams. Their initiatives aim to nurture innovation and facilitate impactful collaborations between academia, public organizations, non-profits, and businesses.

name: Insignius Capital
description: Founded in 2017, Insignius Capital is one of the most active venture funds in Web3. Their mission is to accelerate the development of a new financial system around the world by supporting key entrepreneurs and projects in the Web3 ecosystem.

name: Flat Capital
description: Their commitments to founders are straightforward and supportive: They pledge to provide backing and support, allowing entrepreneurs the autonomy to manage their businesses. They emphasize their role as genuinely long-term investors, with no obligations to demand returns within specific timeframes. They stand ready to offer assistance whenever founders seek their guidance or support. Moreover, they acknowledge that mistakes are a natural part of business growth but stress the importance of learning from them for continuous improvement.

name: Flerie Invest
description: Flerie is a proactive, long-term investor in the life sciences sector, specializing in biotech and pharmaceutical investments on a global scale. Headquartered in Stockholm and London, Flerie oversees a diverse portfolio of more than 30 investments spanning across Europe, Israel, and the US. Their mission is to empower innovative organizations primarily in drug development and related services, offering essential resources and expertise to foster success. Flerie manages assets totaling over SEK 3,000 million across three distinct segments: Product Development, Commercial Growth, and Limited Partnerships.
investmentAreas: Health Care, Biotech, Medtech, Digital Health

name: Navigare Ventures
description: Navigare Ventures is an early-stage investor specializing in science-driven companies, focusing on deep tech sectors such as advanced computing, quantum technologies, synthetic biology, advanced materials, and data-driven life sciences. They are committed long-term investors, supporting companies from Seed to Series A and beyond, and emphasize forming enduring partnerships with founders. Navigare Ventures leverages their extensive industrial and scientific networks to provide capital, networks, and expertise to facilitate the transformation of science startups into successful enterprises.
investmentAreas: Quantum Computing, Synthetic Biology, Data Drive Life Science, Biotech

name: Saab Ventures
description: Saab Ventures serves as the corporate venture arm of the group, established in 2001 to harness Saab's extensive engineering expertise. The primary objective of Saab Ventures is to facilitate the transition of Saab's innovative ideas and technology into independent companies. This initiative plays a pivotal role in fostering a culture of innovation within the organization.
investmentAreas: 3D mapping, mobility, acoustics, ocean tech, deep tech

name: Brightly Ventures
description: They are an early-stage investor with a Nordics focus, known for their hands-on approach in supporting high-potential ideas and facilitating entry into global markets. Beyond financial backing, they make a substantial commitment to each portfolio company, leveraging their extensive network and expertise in company-building. Drawing from their collective experience as former technology entrepreneurs who have achieved international success, they empathize with the challenges of scaling businesses and pioneering industry transformation. Alongside their investors, expert network, and founders' collective, they are dedicated to long-term collaboration and support for ambitious ventures.
investmentAreas: Food tech, Supply chain, software, generalists. nordics

name: EQT Ventures
description: EQT Ventures is a multi-stage VC fund fuelled by some of the world's most obsessive company builders, engineers, designers, marketers, data scientists and scaling experts from success stories such as Booking.com, King, Spotify and Hotels.com. Recognising that building a global success story takes more than just capital, EQT Ventures'​ operational experts are on hand to advise and support ambitious founders on their journeys to building global winners.
investmentAreas: From mobile games to quantum computing

name: NFT Ventures
description: Founded in 2014, we are a prominent fintech investor in Northern Europe and a founding member of the Swedish FinTech Association. Specializing in early-stage investments, we focus on unlisted companies and actively assist them in implementing strong business processes. With a portfolio of over 40 companies across fintech and related sectors like e-commerce and insurtech, we support startups with scalable concepts and dedicated teams across Northern European markets from our offices in Stockholm and Helsinki.

name: Blq Invest
description: BLQ, or Building Legacy Quota, is a tech fund based in Stockholm, Sweden, dedicated to investing in early-stage tech companies navigating the challenging "valley of death" phase. Their mission is to build a lasting legacy by refining and supporting these companies methodically, aiming for profitability and sustained impact long into the future.

name: Alfvén & Didrikson
description: Alfvén & Didrikson is an active and long-term backer of passionate entrepreneurs and ambitious teams. Since 2010, the Alfvén & Didrikson team has made investments in fast growing European companies such as Trustly, Quinyx, Acast, Mentimeter, Tellent and Airmee.
investmentAreas: Fintech, Security, Edtech, Healthtech, Software, Marketplaces

name: Nicoya
description: Nicoya is a business-accelerating investment company deeply committed to food tech, driven by a relentless pursuit of meaningful impact for people, planet, and health. Their ambition is to establish themselves as the leading investor and acceleration partner for mission-driven food tech companies across the Nordics and beyond. Nicoya invests with a long-term perspective, aiming to foster sustainable impact in the realms of people, planet, and health.

name: Cloud Capital
description: "Cloud Capital specialises in investing in SaaS-companies in Sweden through financing solutions that are optimised for the SaaS-business model. We provide traditional venture capital funding, non-dilutive growth capital as a loan - or a combination of both. -Growth capital from €250.000 – €1.000.000 -Don’t give up control or equity -Optimized for SaaS businesses"

name: Vargas Holdings
description: Founded in 2014 in Sweden, Vargas specializes in identifying, validating, financing, launching, and scaling impact companies. Focused on accelerating decarbonization in hard-to-abate industries, Vargas pushes boundaries in critical sectors such as green batteries, steel, and hydrogen. Companies like Polarium, Northvolt, and H2 Green Steel exemplify Vargas' greenfield model, demonstrating their approach to building companies from inception to success.
investmentAreas: Sustainability, Greentech, Impact Investing, Green Hydrogen

name: CBC Investment Group
description: CBC Investment Group invests in early stage IT and MedTech companies with a high level of innovation and a globally scalable business model. CBC also maintains a network of non-professional private investors that are given the opportunity to invest in companies within the CBC portfolio.

name: Zenith Venture Capital
description: Zenith is a boutique VC fund that supports early-stage B2B software companies across the Nordics. Specializing in post-revenue businesses addressing real-world business challenges, Zenith prioritizes building enduring relationships with each portfolio company. Beyond providing financial support, Zenith actively engages with its portfolio, supporting them through the challenges and growth phases of business development. Rooted in ESG principles, Zenith believes that successful businesses can and should contribute positively to society.

name: Fairpoint Capital
description: Fairpoint Capital is a B2B technology investment fund originally established by SEB Venture Capital's technology team, now operating independently with SEB as its main investor. With over two decades of experience in technology venture capital, Fairpoint Capital focuses on minority investments in early growth stage companies, spanning from late seed to B round funding. Initial investments range from 10-40 million SEK, with potential for increased exposure over the holding period. The fund primarily targets the Nordic region, particularly Sweden, but operates without formal geographic restrictions. Fairpoint Capital seeks unique technologies and business models with scalability and sustainable competitive advantages, targeting global markets with strong growth potential and proven commercial viability. Key sectors of interest include AI, IoT, Cloud, Robotics, and Additive Manufacturing, among others.
investmentAreas: AI, IoT, Semiconductor Technology, Cloud, Simulations, Robotics, Big Data, Computer Vision, XR, Autonomous Systems, Security, Additive Manufacturing, System Integration and Materials.

name: KTH Holding
description: KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm is a leading technical and engineering university in Europe, renowned for its extensive research and education programs spanning natural sciences, engineering, architecture, and humanities. The institution is committed to addressing global challenges such as climate change, sustainable energy, urbanization, and societal well-being through innovative research and collaborative partnerships with industry and society. KTH Holding dedicates to investing in KTH University spin-outs.

name: Midroc New Technology
description: Granitor specializes in investing in cutting-edge technologies with significant commercial potential and global relevance. Primarily focused on Swedish companies, Granitor supports innovations in solar-powered water purification, sustainable food production, environmentally neutral energy solutions, zero-emissions transportation, and breakthrough medicines for previously untreatable diseases. By making early investments and maintaining a long-term commitment, Granitor aims to propel sustainable innovations forward, bridging the gap to market adoption. The firm's philosophy emphasizes active engagement and strategic leadership, playing a pivotal role in the operational and strategic development of its portfolio companies.
investmentAreas: Clean Tech, Life Sciences, Sustainability. Renewables, Water Technologies

name: VEQ
description: VEQ, headquartered in Stockholm, is an investment company dedicated to supporting early-stage technology founders striving for positive impact. Specializing in pre-seed and seed stages across Europe, with a particular focus on the Nordics and the Baltics, VEQ acts as a long-term and engaged owner. The firm's mission is to assist founders in transforming innovative ideas into successful and profitable businesses through strategic investment and active support.

name: Behold Ventures
description: Early stage, video game focused VC fund.

name: NEA Partners
description: NEA Partners is a Swedish investment company founded in 2017 with the idea of ​​combining the best of entrepreneurship.

name: Curus
description: Curus is a rapidly expanding investment firm specializing in digital health across the Nordic region, investing across early-stage to growth phases. With a portfolio spanning from minority stakes to fully owned subsidiaries, Curus has made approximately 22 investments to date, supporting prominent entrepreneurs like those behind Mindler, Doctrin, Knodd, Findout Diagnostic, Health Integrator, and Medicheck. Founded as the investment arm of Add Health Media, Curus aims to empower top-tier founders with capital, expertise, strategic guidance, and network access to foster long-term business growth. Supported by seasoned experts in digital health, Curus actively seeks new investment opportunities and acquisitions that complement its subsidiary, Add Health Media. The firm is backed by long-term investors including Alfvén & Didrikson, Stefan Bengtsson's CBS Capital, Alex Stendahl's Stone Valley Group, Lars Lindgren's Venture Securities, Christian Dahlberg (former CEO of SEB in New York), and Johan Bloom, founder of Curus and Add Health Media.
investmentAreas: E-health, Medtech, Health Technology, and Healthcare

name: Rite Ventures
description: Rite specializes in investing in Swedish and Finnish companies operating in IT-services, Software as a Service, and e-commerce sectors. As an active investor, Rite is dedicated to enhancing and preparing early-stage growth companies for advancement into the midmarket. Leveraging a robust value creation process and a steadfast sector-specific focus, Rite serves as a catalyst in nurturing its portfolio companies towards achieving their maximum potential.
investmentAreas: Ecommerce centered retail, Software and IT, Digital brands

name: Almi Invest GreenTech
description: Almi Invest is renowned as Sweden's leading investor in startups, operating through eight regional VC funds and one national Green Tech fund across the country. Managing a substantial equity pool of SEK 3.5 billion, Almi Invest has backed approximately 660 startups since its inception. The company's successful investments have resulted in acquisitions by major industry giants like Google, Apple, Microsoft, and Qlik, as well as through IPOs. Almi Invest operates as a venture capital firm within the Almi Group, supported by the European Regional Development Fund, Almi, Almi Invest, and regional stakeholders.
investmentAreas: Tech, Life Sciences, Green Tech, Industry

name: Incore Invest
description: Focusing on growth stage investments, the team at Incore is passionate about forming close relationships with founders, management teams and existing owners to help businesses expand their existing footprint. We’re active investors, contributing both sector expertise as well as deep networks in the European tech space. Incore is led and backed by seasoned entrepreneurs and family offices from Northern Europe.

name: Karolinska
description: Karolinska Development AB is an investment firm focused on identifying and nurturing medical innovations. It invests in companies that develop these innovations into products aimed at improving patient outcomes and achieving robust financial returns. The company leverages access to cutting-edge medical research from institutions like the Karolinska Institutet, aiming to build successful ventures around leading scientists. Karolinska Development manages a portfolio of 10 companies focused on innovative treatments for severe diseases. Its leadership includes venture capital experts, experienced entrepreneurs, and a global network of specialists.

name: Sound Bioventures
description: Sound Bioventures is a Venture Capital firm that Invests in private clinical stage biotherapeutics companies in Europe and USA. The fund has a geographic footprint on both sides of the Atlantic and will support the clinical development of novel medicines for diseases of high unmet medical need.
investmentAreas: Industrial Biotechnology, Marine Biotechnolgy, Agricultural Biotechnology, Food Biotechnology

name: EIR Ventures
description: Eir Ventures, based in the Nordic region, specializes in life sciences venture capital. With extensive experience and a strong network, they focus on investing in innovative medical solutions addressing critical unmet needs. Their team, renowned for managing over €4 billion in assets and achieving numerous successful exits, collaborates closely with universities and incubators to drive advancements in therapies, medical technology, and digital health.

name: Aggregate Media
description: Aggregate Media is a venture capital fund that specializes in media-for-equity investments, aimed at boosting companies' marketing efforts. Founded in 2002, the fund has facilitated over 250 transactions across diverse industries. Supported by prominent Nordic media houses, Aggregate Media offers a wide-ranging media mix, from out-of-home and magazines to radio, daily press, display, and TV. This support enables companies lacking capital for media advertising to accelerate their expansion and growth.

name: Segulah Medical Acceleration
description: Segulah Medical Acceleration specializes in investing in and nurturing transformative businesses focused on medical technologies and associated value chain solutions. These companies leverage cutting-edge research to develop real-world applications in areas like medical devices, diagnostics, and life science tools. Segulah Medical Acceleration plays a pivotal role in bridging the gap between innovative concepts and commercial validation, facilitating the global market entry of advanced medical research solutions.
investmentAreas: Medtech, Diagnostics, Life science tools, Healthtech, Value chain technologies

name: VEF
description: They are dedicated and experienced investors in fintech and emerging markets. Their purpose is to create long-term sustainable value for their shareholders by investing in the future of finance across emerging markets, from Brazil to India. From investment to exit, they adopt a long-term perspective to support entrepreneurs and their teams on their journey.

name: EQT Ventures
description: A purpose-driven global investment organization, EQT has a 30-year track record of delivering consistent and attractive returns across multiple geographies, sectors, and strategies. They have multiple funds under management: EQT Ventures, EQT Life Sciences, EQT Private Equity, etc.

name: Sciety
description: Sciety was started in 2016 by a founding team with diverse backgrounds in physics, business, medicine and finance. Since our start, we have invested over 1 billion SEK in 25 companies, whereof 8 companies have been successfully acquired or listed on the stock exchange. We are based in Stockholm, but travel across the Nordics to meet with leading ventures and investors.

name: Klint Ventures
description: Klint Ventures is an innovative investment company that is passionate about making venture capital accessible, intriguing, and enticing by bringing primarily Swedish and Nordic tech enabled companies to international investors. As Klint Ventures is not an investment fund, it has a more dynamic and flexible mandate with no fix end date and no lock-in period. This is a good structure for the long-term relationship with the portfolio companies we prefer. Klint Ventures is committed to taking an active ownership role to our portfolio companies.
investmentAreas: Technology based companies with highly scalable business models, with a focus on B2B SaaS and Impact investments. Our geographical focus is the Nordic countries.
